page.title: 02Radley Village Gen. Survey
page.content: Of 12th Century origin, (Radelea, Radelege,) has a population of 4674, in 1682 dwelling stock,(incl. mobile homes.) (1981 Census figures.) The village centre contains the shops, Post Office, Public House, Railway Station, Church (C.E.) and School (C.E.), plus pre-and mainly post- 1945 housing, private and Council. There are two small manuf. industries and a microphotography business. To the E. is Lower Radley,(incl. a Caravan park,) and the old village, a tumulus, and gravel wkgs. To the N.(1 mile,) are 3 Caravan parks in Radley Large Wood, at Bigwood, Pebble Hill and Sugworth Lane. Radley offers little employment, but many social and leisure amenities for a village of its size, run by Church and other organisations. Road and rail transport serves the village. The village has a Parish Council.
